description.p: The domain of madness celebrates the variety of shapes the mind can take, reveling in the truth and freedom of madness. Many of the gods of madness are considered Evil by nature but that isn't quite true. However a lawful madness god doesn't exist

sheet.description: The domain of madness celebrates the variety of shapes the mind can take, reveling in the truth and freedom of madness. Many of the gods of madness are considered Evil by nature but that isn't quite true. However a lawful madness god doesn't exist

description.p: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Madness Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.
When you choose this domain at 1st level you gain Vicious Mockery cantrip

sheet.description: When you choose this domain at 1st level you gain Vicious Mockery cantrip

description.p: At 1st level you can use an action to enter a trance. you become incapacitated for 1 minute and begin to see visions. The DM rolls a d6 in secret, on a 5 or 6 the vision shows a real threat, on a 1 to 4 the vision shows a fake threat. you can do this a number of times equivalent to your wisdom modifier per long rest

sheet.description: At 1st level you can use an action to enter a trance. you become incapacitated for 1 minute and begin to see visions. The DM rolls a d6 in secret, on a 5 or 6 the vision shows a real threat, on a 1 to 4 the vision shows a fake threat. you can do this a number of times equivalent to {{wisdom:modifier}} times per long rest

description.p: Immediately after a creature hits you you can use your reaction to force them to suffer from your madness. They must make a wisdom saving throw against your spell save, on a failed save they take 2 + your cleric level psychic damage and are frightened till the end of your next turn. You can use this a number of time equivalent to your wisdom modifier per long rest.

sheet.description: Immediately after a creature hits you you can use your reaction to force them to suffer from your madness. They must make a wisdom saving throw against your spell save, on a failed save they take 2 + {{level:cleric}} psychic damage and are frightened till the end of your next turn. You can use this a number of time equivalent to {{wisdom:modifier}} times per long rest.

description.p: As an action you choose a point you can see within 60 feet. Each creature within 10ft of the point must make a wisdom saving throw. on a failed saving throw they take 1d6 + your cleric level psychic damage and becomes frightened for 1 minute. In this frightened state it treats all other creatures as enemies.

sheet.description: As an action you choose a point you can see within 60 feet. Each creature within 10ft of the point must make a wisdom saving throw. on a failed saving throw they take 1d6 + {{level:cleric}} psychic damage and becomes frightened for 1 minute. description.p: Starting at 6th level When you deal psychic damage to a creature you can force it to walk up to 10ft in any direction.

sheet.description: Starting at 6th level When you deal psychic damage to a creature you can force it to walk up to 10ft in any direction.

description.p: Starting at 8th level you can add your wisdom modifier to any damage you deal with a cleric cantrip.

sheet.description: Starting at 8th level you can add {{wisdom:modifier}} to any damage you deal with a cleric cantrip.

description.p: At 17th level you can't be frightened or charmed and you have immunity to psychic damage.
